meanings.definition: Make a characteristic short, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The bird was chirking loudly in the tree.
meanings.sent2: I heard the crickets chirking in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The chirking of the bird made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chirking through the room.
meanings.sent5: The chirking of the crickets filled the night with music.

meanings.definition: To utter a short, sharp sound, as a bird.
meanings.sent1: She chirking happily when she saw her friend.
meanings.sent2: The robin chirking in the garden sounded cheerful.
meanings.sent3: The baby's chirking made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His voice chirking with excitement as he told the story.
meanings.sent5: The chirking of the blue jay brightened up the morning.

meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp sound, as a cricket.
meanings.sent1: The cricket chirking in the grass was a soothing sound.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the crickets chirking softly in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The chirking of the cricket added to the peaceful evening.
meanings.sent4: The chirking of the cricket was like a tiny orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The chirking of the cricket lulled me to sleep.
